summary: Email correspondence from attorney Teri Gibbs to a prosecutor's office regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004. The email includes attached photographs of the clients from 2004 for potential identification in photos seized from Epstein's home.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the individual against whom victim reports have been made; clients believe they were assaulted by him in or around June 2004.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Author of the email, representing clients who are potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein; coordinating interview scheduling with the prosecutor's office.

persons.name: Ms. Moe
persons.context: Recipient of the email, presumably from the prosecutor's office handling the case against Jeffrey Epstein (19 Cr. 490).

connections.description: Gibbs is an attorney representing clients who are making victim reports against Epstein.
Attorney coordinating with prosecutor regarding client interviews for the Epstein case.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two clients believe they were assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Initial Contact with Law Firm
events.description: The attorney's firm spoke with the prosecutor's office regarding their clients who are potential victims.

events.title: Scheduled Interview for Client
events.description: One client is available for an in-person interview on this date.

events.title: Alternative Interview Date
events.description: One client is available for an in-person interview on this date as an alternative.

keyFacts: Two new potential victims came forward in August 2019, alleging assaults by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.
Attorney Teri Gibbs was coordinating with the prosecutor's office (case 19 Cr. 490) to schedule interviews for these clients.
Photographs of the clients from 2004 were provided to the prosecution to help identify them in photos seized from Epstein's home.
The email indicates an ongoing investigation and evidence collection effort by prosecutors regarding Epstein's activities.
